head.supplied: ¶ To carry out the wishes of his ¶ xcellency ¶ the Vice Roy it will be necessary to give orders for the collecting of these seeds, as they cannot be obtained by immediate purchase in the market. Th...

div.p: V70/12595, [unit 674, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria].

To proof.
On 20 August 1870, Charles Girdlestone, Officiating Junior Under Secretary to the Governor of India, at the direction of the Viceroy and Governor of India, wrote to the Colonial Secretary to the Government of Victoria asking to be sent seeds of the eucalypts Sideroxylon, Fissilis and Amygdalnia. The request was forwarded to M by the Under Secretary, W. H. Odgers, on 28 September 1870.
check location entry - is this the correct unit & VPRS?
To carry out the wishes of his xcellency the Vice Roy it will be necessary to give orders for the collecting of these seeds, as they cannot be obtained by immediate purchase in the market. The price of Eucalyptus Sideroxylon seeds, some months ago supplied to the Indian Governments was £1.10/ pr lb; the price of seeds of Euc. amygdalina and Euc. fissilis will be considerably less. If the Hon. the Chief Secretary entrusts me with ordering these seeds and as on former occasions be pleased to undertake the temporary outlay on behalf of the Central Government of India, I shall at once do my best to arrange for getting [good] fresh seeds as cheaply as possible

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
30/9/70
On 5 October 1870, the Chief Secretary, James McCulloch, minuted: 'Dr von Mueller is authorised to take the necessary steps'.
See also M to J. McCulloch, 29 December 1870 (in this edition as 70-12-29a).
